title: CY60030: Inorganic Photochemistry - Quick Facts
text:
CY60030
Course name | Inorganic Photochemistry
Offered by | Chemistry
Credits | 3
L-T-P | 3-0-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | Autumn

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisite : NilExcited states: excited states, decay, quantum yield, physico chemical laws. Examples of photochemical reactions: photochemical reactions of small molecules: NO, NO2, N2O, CO, O2, O3, SO2 etc.; mechanism and importance; photo redox substitution, isomerization, prompt and delayed reaction, metal bonded systems, solar energy conversion and storage, photo splitting of water by photo galvanic method and semi conductor electrodes. Metal ion catalysis of organic reactions: mechanisms and applications.
